verses.name: Proverbs 30:29
verses.text: There be three things which go well, yea, four are comely in going:

verses.name: Proverbs 30:30
verses.text: A lion which is strongest among beasts, and turneth not away for any;

verses.name: Proverbs 30:31
verses.text: A greyhound; an he goat also; and a king, against whom there is no rising up.

verses.name: Proverbs 30:32
verses.text: If thou hast done foolishly in lifting up thyself, or if thou hast thought evil, lay thine hand upon thy mouth.

verses.name: Proverbs 30:33
verses.text: Surely the churning of milk bringeth forth butter, and the wringing of the nose bringeth forth blood: so the forcing of wrath bringeth forth strife.
